Class FileGenerator

java.lang.Object
FileGenerator
public class FileGenerator extends Object
Generate a test data file of records. Each record is 4 bytes: 2 bytes for the key (a java short, used for sorting), 2 bytes for the value (a java short). A group of 2048 records is a block. Depending on the method, you can generate two types of files: ASCII or raw binary shorts. In ASCII mode, the records are constrained to specific values which align with specific ASCII values. Reading this file as text/ascii will show a record in this format: [space][letter][space][space]. In Binary mode, the keys and values of a record are in the range [1-30000). Raw binary is not easily human-readable, and often looks like textual garbage.
Version:
2024-03-24
Author:
Cliff Shaffer, Patrick Sullivan

    • FileGenerator

      public FileGenerator(String fname, int numBlocks)
      Creates a FileGenerator object for making random files of data.
      Parameters:
      fname - the file name (example 'oneBlock.txt' or 'data.bin')
      numBlocks - number of blocks of data in the file. each block is

  • Method Details

    • setSeed

      public void setSeed(long seed)
      [Optional] Sets the rng seed to make generation deterministic instead of random. Files generated using the same seed will be exactly the same. Can be helpful for consistent testing.
      Parameters:
      seed - the seed
